abstract: DealBook Dialogue: Isaac D. Corre, a senior managing director at Eton Park Capital Management, argues that regulators and central bankers need an effective set of regulatory tools to address problems that may arise at nonbank credit providers.
snippet: DealBook Dialogue: Isaac D. Corre, a senior managing director at Eton Park Capital Management, argues that regulators and central bankers need an effective set of regulatory tools to address problems that may arise at nonbank credit providers.
lead_paragraph: Isaac D. Corre is a senior managing director at Eton Park Capital Management.

headline.main: Dealing With the Shadow Banking System

abstract: A labor union that has been a persistent critic of Kenneth D. Lewis, Bank of America‘s chief executive, asked Obama’s pay czar to stop the bank from making retirement payments to Mr. Lewis when he leaves at the end of the year.
snippet: A labor union that has been a persistent critic of Kenneth D. Lewis, Bank of America‘s chief executive, asked Obama’s pay czar to stop the bank from making retirement payments to Mr. Lewis when he leaves at the end of the year.
lead_paragraph: Update | 4:36 p.m. A big labor union that has been a persistent critic of Kenneth D. Lewis, Bank of America‘s chief executive, asked the Obama administration’s pay czar on Thursday to stop the bank from making any retirement payments to Mr. Lewis when he retires at the end of the year.

headline.main: Now, BofA Chief’s Pension Is Under Fire
